page.title: 05WILD LIFE IN ST. VEEP
page.content: Within the area, which largely consists of fields and woodlands, there are{badgers, foxes, stoats and {weasels}which feed on the smaller mammals like{mice, rats, voles, {rabbits, shrews and hedgehogs. The most unwelcome sight is probably the{mink,}for it is not a native animal and it kills a lot more animals than it needs to feed itself. {Bats}are a common sight almost everywhere, they dart around in the air catching insects on the wing on summer evenings. The only snakes are{grass-snakes and{adders,}but there are many{slow {worms,}which are legless lizards.
